Posts.Content: Willowz wrote: I am 40 years old, no history of breast cancer in my family. I had my first 3D mammogram last Wednesday, and today they called me to have me come back in Monday for another mammogram and an ultra sound. They found "amorphous calcifications in a grouped distribution seen in the left breast at 7 o'clock." The findings also say "the breasts are heterogeneously dense, which may obscure small masses." Should I be worried? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Trying not to freak out Willowz SharonRose2017

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2017 10:16PM - edited Jun 30, 2017 10:16PM by Willowz Thanks for replying so quickly! No recommendations yet, they will let me know Monday after the ultra sound.
Posts.Title: Trying not to freak out Willowz SharonRose2017
